page.title: 01The River Severn-Gloucester
page.content: The River Severn dominates this area.It influences the surrounding country and mans attempts to control it.To the south the river divides into 2 channels,and becomes one 4 miles upstream.The land between is Alney Island and is frequently flooded. This area,until the opening of the Severn Bridge,was for centuries the lowest bridging point across the river.The building of roads and railways has always been beset by major problems.There are now in a 2km area 9 bridges/viaducts.The newest road bridge has a plaque that refers to the first Domesday Book mentioning "a bridge thereabout in 1086". It provides a large open space for Gloucester people to play many sports.It is home for travelling fairground families who return there to live at Pool Meadow in winter.
